reviewText: This work is a next good example of broadening the audience by creating same gender topic movies for mainstream viewers. Unlike"Brokeback Mountain" embedding cowboys' relations from a notion of a sexual attractiveness, this film emphasises on mutual feelings towards a common acquaintance passed away. Andrea came to Dallas, TX, from Italy and NYC where he had attended a friend's wedding, to visit Jeff having informing him of a mutual lose, and their common grief could eventuate future mutual happiness. It is not so boring as some other works being also dialogue-baseds features mostly, because of the professional performing and much better cinematography low budget movies demonstrate usually in general.

I agree that the film is slow and for many, it will be easy to change dvd. My boyfriend watched because I insisted! The story is touching, the scenes with no words but with lots of feelings and boy, the actors are hot.
While the Italian takes his chances travelling to US maybe to find his great love the American, after what they lived through in a very short time, walks from the airport apparently to wake up on next monday back to his routine and forget all about it.
Sitting on my couch watching this dvd It's easy to hope they did something to stay together but real life is very different.
Anyway I loved this story.
